title: Asheville, North Carolina
summary: Asheville (/ˈæʃvɪl/ ASH-vil) is a city in, and the county seat of, Buncombe County, North Carolina, United States.[7] Located at the confluence of the French Broad and Swannanoa rivers, it is the largest city in Western North Carolina, and the state's 12th-most populous city.  According to the 2020 United States Census, the city's population was 94,589,[3] up from 83,393 in the 2010 census.[8]  It is the principal city in the four-county Asheville metropolitan area, which had a population of 424,858 in 2010, and of 469,015 in 2020.[4]
